Customer Service Representative - Casual

Company Name Aimia Inc Company Location Sydney, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 30 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Customer Service Representative - Casual role



If you love helping customers and working in a high performing team, then do we have a role for you!!!



Aimia is a global leader in loyalty management. Our unique capabilities include proven expertise in building proprietary loyalty strategies, launching and managing coalition loyalty programs, creating value through loyalty analytics and driving innovation in the emerging digital and mobile spaces. We build and run loyalty programs for ourselves and for some of the world's best brands.

We currently have several casual positions available for Customer Service Representatives in our call centre. This is an opportunity to join a strong team of Customer Service Representatives who manage the customers of iconic Australian brands.



As a customer service representative, your responsibilities will see you:

  • Handling inbound calls & emails from customers
  • Delivering exceptional customer service for the customer journey
  • Attending to various administrative tasks
  • Being an active member of a high performing team




You will require excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong attention to detail, exceptional customer service and rapport building skills and a happy phone voice.



Passion, enthusiasm and a positive attitude combined with a desire to learn new skills would be seen as an advantage. As with all teams, being flexible and adaptable to change is essential, along with a commitment to contribute to this positive team environment.



If you are still reading, then this is what we can offer you:

  • Shifts available 5 days per week, covering the hours of 8am to 8pm Monday - Friday
  • A chance to further your customer service skills and gain experience in a diverse industry
  • A team that supports and encourages career development
  • A modern office 2 minutes from Wynyard Station




If you want to work hard alongside a fantastic group of colleagues, then this is the role for you!



Candidates must be available to commence five days full time training from Monday 24th September to Friday 28th September 2018. Candidates must have work rights allowing them to work up to 38 hours per week and must have full availability to work rotating shifts within the following hours 8am - 8pm Monday - Fridays.



Please note, all successful applicants will be required to complete a background check prior to commencing.

Entry level

Job description

  • Based in South East
  • Progressive opportunity
  • High profile private business
  • Based in South Eastern suburbs
  • Progressive opportunity
  • High profile private business

Based in the inner South Eastern suburbs of Melbourne, our high profile client is looking to engage an experienced technical Financial Controller to oversee their diverse Group's operations. Reporting into the Chief Financial Officer, this role aims to provide Executive level support not only internally across the business, but also to the broad range of external clients they support on a National basis. In managing the Group's Financial Reporting function, you will lead a financial accounting team responsible for maintaining accounting policies and overseeing their application organisation wide.

Specifically You Will Be Required To
  • Review quarterly, half-yearly and annual accounts to meet external reporting requirements
  • Oversee the Group's statutory requirements, submissions and audits
  • Manage and provide guidance to a team of 2-3 direct reports (financial accounting team)
  • Maintaining the Group's accounting policies and Chart of Accounts
  • Prepare investment acquisition checklists and advise on accounting entries
  • Investigate the impact of changes in accounting treatments and preparation of accounting position papers
  • Manage the cashflow and reporting requirements of a business unit
  • Providing technical accounting guidance to the broader finance team including the family and business accounts team
  • Identify and implement accounting processes to improve efficiency and accuracy of reporting
  • Liaise effectively with internal and external stakeholders

Professionally qualified and with extensive demonstrated experience in a Senior Finance capacity, the successful candidate will have strong commercial acumen, be a strong leader of people and behaviours conducive to a progressive team ethos. This role will naturally progress through the business and a salary commensurate with experience is on offer to work with this high profile family business.

To register your interest, in the first instance please apply for forwarding your CV in word format, quoting ref 23063RD

Job description

Our client is a national commercial law firm offering clients market-leading legal services. As one of Australias's largest and fastest growing fully integrated law firms, they are a recognised leader in Renewable Energy. Due to their ongoing success across their Corporate - Commercial practice, an exciting opportunity has become available for experienced Lawyers to join the team.

On offer is a rewarding career with a firm dedicated to developing the careers of high performing employees and the chance to work with complex, interesting and high-quality clients. As one of the early adopters in the renewable energy markets, our client's footprint amongst innovative energy projects is extensive. We are looking for experienced specialists across the energy market with referenceable work within;

Energy and Resources
* Commercial contracts, procurement, outsourcing, management services and \xa0 \xa0operations contracting, government tender work
* Energy and Resources including the structuring, acquisition, development
\xa0 \xa0and sale of utility-scale renewable energy projects.\xa0
\xa0
Their Melbourne - Commercial team continues to grow, with an enviable deal flow and contractual work seeing the firm consistently ranked high up the league tables. This success has resulted in several opportunities for lawyers with 5-10 years post-admission experience to join our dynamic team. In particular, there are opportunities for candidates with experience to work in the following areas:


  • M&A, both public (including executing and defending takeover bids, schemes of arrangement) and private (including share and asset acquisitions and divestitures (including cross-border transactions);
  • Equity Capital Markets, including IPOs, secondary capital raisings and ASX Listing Rule compliance;
  • Corporate Advisory, including joint ventures, corporate restructures, shareholder agreements, employee share schemes and corporate governance;
  • Energy and Resources, including the structuring, acquisition, development, and sale of utility-scale renewable energy projects;
  • Commercial contracts - procurement, outsourcing, management services and operations contracting, government tender work.

This is an excellent opportunity to join a forward-thinking firm with a strong focus on developing their people for success with real career progression on offer.

With the variety and volume of exciting work across their renewable energy and corporate clients, there has never been a better time to join this forward thinking firm. As one of the top league table leaders and with a reputation as one of Australia's most innovative and progressive firms within the corporate-commercial law, this is a rare opportunity to join our client as part of their dynamic team. Only candidates with relevant experience will be contacted. \xa0Please provide a covering letter and your updated CV.


To register your interest in this position, please apply online quoting reference 2803205\xa0or for a confidential discussion about your career, please contact Jennifer Beachey on +61(0)434613143.\xa0

Professional Services Consultant (SDN)

Company Name Juniper Networks Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 70 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Professional Services Consultant (SDN)

This is a highly technical and customer-facing role, providing primarily post-sales Consulting delivery under the Juniper Networks Professional Services (PS) APAC Team. The role covers Architectural, Design and Implementation Consultancy services for Junipers Networks Solutions. The consultant is expected to drive overall customer solution and delivering the solution to meet the customer’s business objectives while managing within the confines of the agreed scope. The consultant is also expected to be able to manage deviations to scope as part of change management and change handling.

Key Duties And Responsibilities Include

This is a technical role in the PS Theater team, reporting directly to the APAC Practice Team Manager. Specific Responsibilities include:
  • Work with Account teams to enable customer consumption of standard PS offers
  • Collaborate with Customers, Sales, Account, and Business Development teams to understand the unique customer use cases and desired outcomes to enable proper positioning of standard PS offers
  • Provide integration of multiple PS offers into solutions for customers
  • Collaborate with the customer on alignment / inclusion of Juniper solutions into Customer’s Enterprise Architecture
  • Consultation and collaboration with multiple (internal and external) parties, including customers, to understand business and technical requirements, in order to provide, develop, deploy and/or integrate a solution
  • Present and deliver solutions via projects; some basic project management by the consultant is required, e.g. scope, effort, time and problem & risk management
  • Subject Matter Expert in one or more Juniper Networks products/solutions
  • Creation or development of marketable and deployable solutions based on Juniper Networks products/solutions
  • Create necessary high quality documentation and/or presentations to share knowledge and experience in areas of expertise, so to increase the overall effectiveness and efficiency of PS
  • Be involved and support Sales and Account Teams at pre-sales and/or resolution of technical issues
  • Utilizes skills and experience to contribute to the development of company objectives and principles and to achieve goals in effective and efficient ways
  • Provide (technical and non-technical) leadership and guidance to more junior consultants or colleagues
  • Travel for projects required; arrangement of own travel (via company travel agent) and visa requirements
  • Prepared to willingly and constantly share knowledge within the team for the betterment and improvement of other team members.

Requirements
  • Has solid experience of large scale solutions projects delivery to Service Provider and/or Enterprise customers.
  • Has experience in the construction and architecture of virtualized solutions such as NFV, SDN controllers and overarching orchestration platforms.
  • SDN/NFV technical skills:

  • Ideal - Contrail, OpenStack, Contrail Service Orchestration, Ubuntu, Hypervisors, Containers, Docker and other Juniper products including vMX, vSRX, NFX. Knowledge of underlay/overlay networking.
  • Essential - Linux, Scripting (e.g. Perl, Python), DC systems installation & integration into OSS/IT
  • Advantageous - VMware vCenter/NSX, MPLSoGRE, VXLAN, RESTful APIs, Icinga, Junos (awareness not expertise), SLAX/Junos Automation, Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Cobbler
  • Good general understanding of Security as an integral part of any solution.
  • Strong JUNOS skills and excellent hands on and planning capabilities with MX Series products, PTX Series, EX Series, E Series, MX BNG
  • Hands on and planning capabilities in TCP/IP, MPLS, Traffic Engineering, IGP, BGP, Internet peering/exchanges
  • Good Experience in Metro Ethernet, Broadband technologies and Seamless MPLS, QoS and IP related services
  • Has experience with complex solutions architectures that involves software development (using APIs) and or modification as a means of completing the solution.
  • Has Professional Services consulting and business consulting experience, including conflict management and hands on delivery experience of technical projects.
  • Demonstrates an excellent understanding of the industry, the customer's business issues, and the most appropriate solution architecture to meet their business goals.
  • Strong Architectural background including plan, design, and implement phases and best practices
  • Able to bridge the business imperatives and supporting technical solutions that enable the business
  • Capable of operating autonomously and with initiative or when required under direction; ability to decide when either is best
  • Capable of prioritization and making timely decisions even in difficult situations and is responsible and accountable for decisions and actions
  • High drive to succeed by direct contribution or when necessary via collaboration and influence; ability to decide when either is best
  • Expert (verbal and written) communication and interpersonal skills; capable of communicating with audience from different levels and diverse backgrounds, and, maintaining relationships even in difficult situations. English is mandatory. All other languages may be an advantage, e.g. Japanese, Mandarin, Hindi.
  • Expert in technical documentation and presentations
  • Expert collaboration and leadership skills; capable leading others through the use of influence, communication, relationship and/or timing
  • Leads development of complex and/or large scale solutions, identifying and leveraging SMEs and the broader team to complete deliverables as necessary.
  • Ensures best practice methods are used for scoping and delivery of new technology and solutions.
  • Closely monitors progress and quality as well as risks and delays.
  • Works on significant and unique issues where analysis of situations or data requires an evaluation of intangibles.
  • Exercises independent judgment in methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results that are the most conducive to the customer environment and assignment.
  • Creates informal networks involving coordination among groups and individuals.
  • Mentor junior consultants on customer projects to assist with achieving training and development goals.
    • Supervision
    • Acts independently to determine methods and procedures on new or special assignments.
    • Possibly supervises the activities of other consultants assigned to deliver the solution.

    Experience
    • Typically requires 12-15 years of related experience
    • Bachelors or MS degree in Computer Science or Computer/Electrical Engineering
    • Business related qualifications and product certifications on specific solutions that make up the consultants solutions areas.
    • Expert-level (JNCIE, CCIE) networking certifications are desired as appropriate.

    Other Job Specifications
    • Expert communication and interpersonal skills.
    • Expert collaboration and leadership skills.
    • Expert conflict management skills.
    • Expert presentation skills.
    • Strong industry expertise.

Job description


Our client is a speciality chemical manufacturer focussed on delivering products and solutions to industries such as water, packaging electronics and energy. They are currently looking for a EH&S Technician to join then to assist in the implementation of EH&S management system (work processes, standards, procedures) in order to meet business objectives and maintain the licence to operate.


Your responsibilites will include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Implementing detailed, task level, day to day EH&S programs
  • Ensure the Environmental, Saftey, Industrial Hygiene and Health aspects of Operating Discipline are adequate and applied to achieve EH&S performance goals.
  • Be the plant resource and contact for Environmental, IH and Health Safety information and issues.
  • Coach teams and individuals on EH&S related tasks and activities and assist in dveleping and achieving area or plant goals.
  • Perform/coordinate certain environmental, and IH monitoring, data collection, analyzing and reporting for the Plant.

Job description

An exciting opportunity currently exists for an experienced Business Development Manager to join our Business Banking team in Melbourne.

With a focus on the Accounting and Financial Services segment, you will be responsible for driving new client acquisitions, tailoring unique and highly service driven solutions for clients. With a passion for developing new business, you will have the ability to understand complex business structures, analyse financial data and draw appropriate conclusions. You will also enjoy working on complex cash flow deals, be driven to achieve results and pride yourself on providing exceptional solutions to your clients’ business needs.

As an experienced Business Development Manager within Business Banking, you will ideally have developed relationships with clients within the Accounting and Financial Services segment previously and have a proven track record in delivering results. You will demonstrate effectiveness in your planning, have the ability to be innovative, and relish working in a diverse and fast paced environment. In addition, you will be an exceptional communicator who can positively influence teams with your energy, proactivity and professionalism.

This an exciting time to join our growing team where you can be a key driver in enacting change and influencing growth. We are committed to long term growth and this will open opportunities for career development in a forward-thinking organisation that invests in its people.

If you possess the above skills and are looking to take the next step in your career, please submit an application online. For a confidential discussion, please contact Georgie Brown on (03) 9635 8891.

Banking and Financial Services Group comprises Macquarie's retail banking and financial services businesses, providing a diverse range of personal banking, wealth management and business banking products and services to retail customers, advisers, brokers and business clients.
